message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CC, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.NI. 

This paper deals with the performance analysis of LDPC codes under belief-propagation decoding, which is a topic closely related to information theory (cs.IT). The use of spatial coupling is a technique commonly used in coding theory (cs.CC) and the paper specifically focuses on LDPC codes (a type of error-correcting code). The proof technique used in the paper involves potential functions, which are commonly used in the analysis of dynamical systems (cs.DS). The paper also discusses the extension of results to a wide class of graphical models, which is a topic related to statistical inference (cs.SI) and network analysis (cs.NI).
